title: Quebec brings hammer down on doctors by adopting special law to force deal
author: Philip Authier
blurb: The CAQ invoked closure to fast track Bill 2, which includes a new salary structure for physicians and imposes stiff penalties for pressure tactics.
article_text: The CAQ invoked closure to fast track Bill 2, which includes a new salary structure for physicians and imposes stiff penalties for pressure tactics. QUEBEC — Unable to reach a negotiated deal over a new salary structure with doctors, the Coalition Avenir Québec government Friday played hardball,adopting legislation imposing an agreementon them that includes stiff penalties for any retaliatory pressure tactics. title: Habs Mailbag: Jakub Dobes passing eye test as Canadiens' No. 1 goalie
author: Stu Cowan
blurb: His strong play is a big part of Habs' hot start as Samuel Montembeault's struggles continue in loss to Oilers.
article_text: His strong play is a big part of Habs' hot start as Samuel Montembeault's struggles continue in loss to Oilers. title: Canadiens' Patrik Laine out 3-4 months after surgery for muscle injury
author: Stu Cowan
blurb: It seems unlikely the 27-year-old will remain with Montreal beyond this season after surgery in New York to repair a core muscle injury.
article_text: It seems unlikely the 27-year-old will remain with Montreal beyond this season after surgery in New York to repair a core muscle injury. The Canadiens’ Patrik Laine and his wife have both expressed how much they love Montreal and would love to stay here beyond this season. There with you then. Here with you now. title: 'There is no big picture' for roadwork in Montreal
author: Linda Gyulai
blurb: How many times can one stretch of road be ripped up? A Gazette investigation looks at several streets where the answer is: too often.
article_text: How many times can one stretch of road be ripped up? A Gazette investigation looks at several streets where the answer is: too often. Montrealers who think the city does construction work over and over on the same streets: it’s not your imagination. There with you then. Here with you now. title: Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez tells Quebec doctors: 'Please, don't leave'
author: Philip Authier
blurb: "Wait for a year, we're going to be there. We're going to sit down with you and negotiate," he said after the CAQ adopted a new law dictating doctor salaries.
article_text: "Wait for a year, we're going to be there. We're going to sit down with you and negotiate," he said after the CAQ adopted a new law dictating doctor salaries. TROIS-RIVIÈRES — Quebec Liberal leader Pablo Rodriguez promised Saturday to scrap the Coalition Avenir Québec government’s new law dictating doctor salaries and implored physicians thinking of leaving Quebec to sit tight.
